direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are used for object comparison and state verification, with hashCode often used in conjunction with equals for hash-based collections.
Both methods involve processing the internal state of the object, though toString is more focused on generating a string representation.
Both methods access and process the internal state of the object, though getChangedElements is more focused on retrieving specific elements.
